text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses in the tent of meeting in the desert of Sinai on the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites departed from the land of Egypt. He said:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the entire Israelite community by their clans and families, counting the name of every individual male.
speaker: Narrator

text: You and Aaron are to number all in Israel who can serve in the army, those who are twenty years old or older, by their divisions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to help you there is to be a man from each tribe, each man the head of his family.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now these are the names of the men who are to help you:
from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: from Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Asher, Pagiel son of Ocran;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones chosen from the community, leaders of their ancestral tribes. They were the heads of the thousands of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been mentioned specifically by name,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they assembled the entire community together on the first day of the second month. Then the people recorded their ancestry by their clans and families, and the men who were twenty years old or older were listed by name individually,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the Lord had commanded Moses. And so he numbered them in the desert of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they were as follows:
The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn son of Israel: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name individually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Reuben were 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Simeon: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males numbered of them twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name individually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Simeon were 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Gad: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Gad were 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Judah: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Judah were 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Issachar: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Issachar were 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Zebulun: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Zebulun were 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the sons of Joseph:
From the descendants of Ephraim: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Ephraim were 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Manasseh: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Manasseh were 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Benjamin: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Benjamin were 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Dan: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Dan were 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Asher: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Asher were 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Naphtali: According to the records of their clans and families, all the males twenty years old or older who could serve in the army were listed by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered from the tribe of Naphtali were 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the men whom Moses and Aaron numbered along with the twelve leaders of Israel, each of whom was from his own family.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Israelites who were twenty years old or older, who could serve in Israel’s army, were numbered according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all those numbered totaled 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites, according to the tribe of their fathers, were not numbered among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord had said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Only the tribe of Levi you must not number or count with the other Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the testimony, over all its furnishings and over everything in it. They must carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; and they must attend to it and camp around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites must take it down, and whenever the tabernacle is to be reassembled, the Levites must set it up. Any unauthorized person who approaches it must be killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Israelites will camp according to their divisions, each man in his camp, and each man by his standard.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites must camp around the tabernacle of the testimony, so that the Lord’s anger will not fall on the Israelite community. The Levites are responsible for the care of the tabernacle of the testimony.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses—that is what they did.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Every one of the Israelites must camp under his standard with the emblems of his family; they must camp at some distance around the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now those who will be camping on the east, toward the sunrise, are the divisions of the camp of Judah under their standard. The leader of the people of Judah is Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who will be camping next to them are the tribe of Issachar. The leader of the people of Issachar is Nethanel son of Zuar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next will be the tribe of Zebulun. The leader of the people of Zebulun is Eliab son of Helon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those numbered of the camp of Judah, according to their divisions, are 186,400. They will travel at the front.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the south will be the divisions of the camp of Reuben under their standard. The leader of the people of Reuben is Elizur son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who will be camping next to them are the tribe of Simeon. The leader of the people of Simeon is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next will be the tribe of Gad. The leader of the people of Gad is Eliasaph son of Deuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those numbered of the camp of Reuben, according to their divisions, are 151,450. They will travel second.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the tent of meeting with the camp of the Levites will travel in the middle of the camps. They will travel in the same order as they camped, each in his own place under his standard.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the west will be the divisions of the camp of Ephraim under their standard. The leader of the people of Ephraim is Elishama son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them will be the tribe of Manasseh. The leader of the people of Manasseh is Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next will be the tribe of Benjamin. The leader of the people of Benjamin is Abidan son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those numbered of the camp of Ephraim, according to their divisions, are 108,100. They will travel third.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the north will be the divisions of the camp of Dan, under their standards. The leader of the people of Dan is Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who will be camping next to them are the tribe of Asher. The leader of the people of Asher is Pagiel son of Ocran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next will be the tribe of Naphtali. The leader of the people of Naphtali is Ahira son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered in his division are 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those numbered of the camp of Dan are 157,600. They will travel last, under their standards.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the Israelites, numbered according to their families. All those numbered in the camps, by their divisions, are 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites were not numbered among the other Israelites, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses; that is the way they camped under their standards, and that is the way they traveled, each with his clan and family.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the records of Aaron and Moses when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he consecrated to minister as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered strange fire before the Lord in the desert of Sinai, and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests in the presence of Aaron their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron the priest, that they may serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are responsible for his needs and the needs of the whole community before the tent of meeting, by attending to the service of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they are responsible for all the furnishings of the tent of meeting, and for the needs of the Israelites, as they serve in the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they will be assigned exclusively to him out of all the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you are to appoint Aaron and his sons, and they will be responsible for their priesthood, but the unauthorized person who comes near must be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, I myself have taken the Levites from among the Israelites instead of every firstborn who opens the womb among the Israelites. So the Levites belong to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: because all the firstborn are mine. When I destroyed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set apart for myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast. They belong to me. I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Number the Levites by their clans and their families; every male from a month old and upward you are to number.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses numbered them according to the word of the Lord, just as he had been commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath by their families were: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari by their families were Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Gershon came the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites; these were the families of the Gershonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered, counting every male from a month old and upward, were 7,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle toward the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the leader of the clan of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the responsibilities of the Gershonites in the tent of meeting included the tabernacle, the tent with its covering, the curtain at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard that surrounded the tabernacle and the altar, and their ropes, plus all the service connected with these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Kohath came the family of the Amramites, the family of the Izharites, the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites; these were the families of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Counting every male from a month old and upward, there were 8,600. They were responsible for the care of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the Kohathites were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the leader of the clan of the families of the Kohathites was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their responsibilities included the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, and the utensils of the sanctuary with which they ministered, the curtain, and all their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the head of all the Levitical leaders was Eleazar son of Aaron the priest. He was appointed over those who were responsible for the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Merari came the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites; these were the families of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those of them who were numbered, counting every male from a month old and upward, were 6,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the leader of the clan of the families of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail. These were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The appointed responsibilities of the Merarites included the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, its posts, its sockets, its utensils, plus all the service connected with these things,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars of the courtyard all around, with their sockets, their pegs, and their ropes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who were to camp in front of the tabernacle on the east, in front of the tent of meeting, were Moses, Aaron, and his sons. They were responsible for the needs of the sanctuary and for the needs of the Israelites, but the unauthorized person who approached was to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered by the word of the Lord, according to their families, every male from a month old and upward, were 22,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Number all the firstborn males of the Israelites from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take the Levites for me—I am the Lord—instead of all the firstborn males among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn of the livestock of the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses numbered all the firstborn males among the Israelites, as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the firstborn males, by the number of the names from a month old and upward, totaled 22,273.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn males among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock. And the Levites will be mine. I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the redemption of the 273 firstborn males of the Israelites who exceed the number of the Levites,
speaker: Narrator

text: collect five shekels for each one individually; you are to collect this amount in the currency of the sanctuary shekel (this shekel is twenty gerahs).
speaker: Narrator

text: And give the money for the redemption of the excess number of them to Aaron and his sons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were in excess of those redeemed by the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the firstborn males of the Israelites he collected the money, 1,365 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the Kohathites from among the Levites, by their families and by their clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, all who enter the company to do the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the Kohathites in the tent of meeting, relating to the most holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it is time for the camp to journey, Aaron and his sons must come and take down the screening curtain and cover the ark of the testimony with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they must put over it a covering of fine leather and spread over that a cloth entirely of blue, and then they must insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the table of the presence they must spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the pans, the bowls, and the pitchers for pouring, and the Bread of the Presence must be on it continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must spread over them a scarlet cloth, and cover the same with a covering of fine leather; and they must insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They must take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand of the light, with its lamps, its wick-trimmers, its trays, and all its oil vessels, with which they service it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they must put it with all its utensils in a covering of fine leather, and put it on a carrying beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They must spread a blue cloth on the gold altar, and cover it with a covering of fine leather; and they must insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they must take all the utensils of the service, with which they serve in the sanctuary, put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering of fine leather, and put them on a carrying beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, they must take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they must place on it all its implements with which they serve there—the trays, the meat forks, the shovels, the basins, and all the utensils of the altar—and they must spread on it a covering of fine leather, and then insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, when the camp is ready to journey, then the Kohathites will come to carry them; but they must not touch any holy thing, or they will die. These are the responsibilities of the Kohathites with the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The appointed responsibility of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest is for the oil for the light, and the spiced incense, and the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil; he also has the appointed responsibility over all the tabernacle with all that is in it, over the sanctuary and over all its furnishings.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not allow the tribe of the families of the Kohathites to be cut off from among the Levites;
speaker: Narrator

text: but in order that they will live and not die when they approach the most holy things, do this for them: Aaron and his sons will go in and appoint each man to his service and his responsibility.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Kohathites are not to go in to watch while the holy things are being covered, or they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Also take a census of the Gershonites also, by their clans and by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must number them from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, all who enter the company to do the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of Gershonites, as they serve and carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must carry the curtains for the tabernacle and the tent of meeting with its covering, the covering of fine leather that is over it, the curtains for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings for the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance of the gate of the court, which is around the tabernacle and the altar, and their ropes, along with all the furnishings for their service and everything that is made for them. So they are to serve.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the service of the Gershonites, whether carrying loads or for any of their work, will be at the direction of Aaron and his sons. You will assign them all their tasks as their responsibility.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites concerning the tent of meeting. Their responsibilities will be under the authority of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for the sons of Merari, you are to number them by their families and by their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must number them from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, all who enter the company to do the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what they are responsible to carry as their entire service in the tent of meeting: the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, its posts, its sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their sockets, tent pegs, and ropes, along with all their furnishings and everything for their service. You are to assign by name the items that each man is responsible to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the Merarites, their entire service concerning the tent of meeting, under the authority of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the community numbered the Kohathites by their families and by clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who entered the company for the work in the tent of meeting;
speaker: Narrator

text: and those of them numbered by their families were 2,750.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were those numbered from the families of the Kohathites, everyone who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord by the authority of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered from the Gershonites, by their families and by their clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who entered the company for the work in the tent of meeting—
speaker: Narrator

text: those of them numbered by their families, by their clans, were 2,630.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were those numbered from the families of the Gershonites, everyone who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those numbered from the families of the Merarites, by their families, by their clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who entered the company for the work in the tent of meeting—
speaker: Narrator

text: those of them numbered by their families were 3,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those numbered from the families of the Merarites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord by the authority of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel numbered by their families and by their clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who entered to do the work of service and the work of carrying relating to the tent of meeting—
speaker: Narrator

text: those of them numbered were 8,580.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the word of the Lord they were numbered, by the authority of Moses, each according to his service and according to what he was to carry. Thus were they numbered by him, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites to expel from the camp every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever becomes defiled by a corpse.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must expel both men and women; you must put them outside the camp, so that they will not defile their camps, among which I live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites did so, and expelled them outside the camp. As the Lord had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the Israelites, ‘When a man or a woman commits any sin that people commit, thereby breaking faith with the Lord, and that person is found guilty,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he must confess his sin that he has committed and must make full reparation, add one-fifth to it, and give it to whomever he wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the individual has no close relative to whom reparation can be made for the wrong, the reparation for the wrong must be paid to the Lord for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement by which atonement is made for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every offering of all the Israelites’ holy things that they bring to the priest will be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man’s holy things will be his; whatever any man gives the priest will be his.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and behaves unfaithfully toward him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a man goes to bed with her for sexual relations without her husband knowing it, and it is undetected that she has defiled herself since there was no witness against her, nor was she caught in the act—
speaker: Narrator

text: and if jealous feelings come over him and he becomes suspicious of his wife when she is defiled, or if jealous feelings come over him and he becomes suspicious of his wife, when she is not defiled—
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man must bring his wife to the priest, and he must bring the offering required for her, one-tenth of an ephah of barley meal; he must not pour olive oil on it or put frankincense on it because it is a grain offering of suspicion, a grain offering for remembering, for bringing iniquity to remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Then the priest will bring her near and have her stand before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will then take holy water in a pottery jar, and take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle, and put it into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will have the woman stand before the Lord, and he will uncover the woman’s head and put the grain offering for remembering in her hands, which is the grain offering of suspicion. The priest will hold in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will put the woman under oath and say to her, “If no other man has gone to bed with you, and if you have not gone astray and become defiled while under your husband’s authority, may you be free from this bitter water that brings a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you have gone astray while under your husband’s authority, and if you have defiled yourself and some man other than your husband has had sexual relations with you—”
speaker: Narrator

text: (then the priest will put the woman under the oath of the curse and will say to her) “the Lord make you an attested curse among your people if the Lord makes your thigh fall away and your abdomen swell,
speaker: Narrator

text: and this water that causes the curse will go into your stomach and make your abdomen swell and your thigh rot.” Then the woman must say, “Amen, amen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Then the priest will write these curses on a scroll and then scrape them off into the bitter water.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water that brings a curse will enter her to produce bitterness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will take the grain offering of suspicion from the woman’s hand, wave the grain offering before the Lord, and bring it to the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial portion, burn it on the altar, and afterward make the woman drink the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has made her drink the water, then if she has defiled herself and behaved unfaithfully toward her husband, the water that brings a curse will enter her to produce bitterness—her abdomen will swell, her thigh will fall away, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the woman has not defiled herself, and is clean, then she will be free of ill effects and will be able to bear children.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘This is the law for cases of jealousy, when a wife, while under her husband’s authority, goes astray and defiles herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: or when jealous feelings come over a man and he becomes suspicious of his wife; then he must have the woman stand before the Lord, and the priest will carry out all this law upon her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man will be free from iniquity, but that woman will bear the consequences of her iniquity.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites, and tell them, ‘When someone—either a man or a woman—takes a special vow, to take a vow as a Nazirite, to separate himself to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: he must separate himself from wine and strong drink; he must drink neither vinegar made from wine nor vinegar made from strong drink, nor may he drink any juice of grapes, nor eat fresh grapes or raisins.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he must not eat anything that is produced by the grapevine, from seed to skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘All the days of the vow of his separation no razor may be used on his head until the time is fulfilled for which he separated himself to the Lord. He will be holy, and he must let the locks of hair on his head grow long.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘All the days that he separates himself to the Lord he must not contact a dead body.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not defile himself even for his father or his mother or his brother or his sister if they die, because the separation for his God is on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he must be holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If anyone dies very suddenly beside him and he defiles his consecrated head, then he must shave his head on the day of his purification—on the seventh day he must shave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day he is to bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the entrance to the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will offer one for a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because of his transgression in regard to the corpse. So he must reconsecrate his head on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must rededicate to the Lord the days of his separation and bring a male lamb in its first year as a reparation offering, but the former days will not be counted because his separation was defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite: When the days of his separation are fulfilled, he must be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he must present his offering to the Lord: one male lamb in its first year without blemish for a burnt offering, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish for a purification offering, one ram without blemish for a peace offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a basket of bread made without yeast, cakes of fine flour mixed with olive oil, wafers made without yeast and smeared with olive oil, and their grain offering and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Then the priest must present all these before the Lord and offer his purification offering and his burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he must offer the ram as a peace offering to the Lord along with the basket of bread made without yeast; the priest must also offer his grain offering and his drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Then the Nazirite must shave his consecrated head at the entrance to the tent of meeting and must take the hair from his consecrated head and put it on the fire where the peace offering is burning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest must take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one cake made without yeast from the basket, and one wafer made without yeast, and put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated head;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the priest must wave them as a wave offering before the Lord; it is a holy portion for the priest, together with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the raised offering. After this the Nazirite may drink wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘This is the law of the Nazirite who vows to the Lord his offering according to his separation, as well as whatever else he can provide. Thus he must fulfill his vow that he makes, according to the law of his separation.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell Aaron and his sons, ‘This is the way you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord bless you and protect you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord make his face to shine upon you,
and be gracious to you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lift up his countenance upon you
and give you peace.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses had completed setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it and all its furnishings, and he anointed and consecrated the altar and all its utensils.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their clans, made an offering. They were the leaders of the tribes; they were the ones who had been supervising the numbering.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought their offerings before the Lord, six covered carts and twelve oxen—one cart for every two of the leaders, and an ox for each one; and they presented them in front of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Receive these gifts from them, that they may be used in doing the work of the tent of meeting; and you must give them to the Levites, to every man as his service requires.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses accepted the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave two carts and four oxen to the Gershonites, as their service required;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he gave four carts and eight oxen to the Merarites, as their service required, under the authority of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the Kohathites he gave none, because the service of the holy things, which they carried on their shoulders, was their responsibility.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders offered gifts for the dedication of the altar when it was anointed. And the leaders presented their offering before the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord said to Moses, “They must present their offering, one leader for each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab, from the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His offering was one silver platter weighing 130 shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing 70 shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each of them full of fine flour mixed with olive oil as a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one gold pan weighing 10 shekels, full of incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one male goat for a purification offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented an offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He offered for his offering one silver platter weighing 130 shekels and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing 70 shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each of them full of fine flour mixed with olive oil as a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: His offering was one silver platter weighing 130 shekels and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing 70 shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each of them full of fine flour mixed with olive oil as a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: one male goat for a purification offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ocran.

text: On the twelfth day Ahira son of Enan, leader of the Naphtalites, presented an offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: His offering was one silver platter weighing 130 shekels and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing 70 shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each of them full of fine flour mixed with olive oil as a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one gold pan weighing 10 shekels, full of incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one male goat for a purification offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the dedication for the altar from the leaders of Israel, when it was anointed: twelve silver platters, twelve silver sprinkling bowls, and twelve gold pans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each silver platter weighed 130 shekels, and each silver sprinkling bowl weighed 70 shekels. All the silver of the vessels weighed 2,400 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The twelve gold pans full of incense weighed 10 shekels each, according to the sanctuary shekel; all the gold of the pans weighed 120 shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the animals for the burnt offering were 12 young bulls, 12 rams, 12 male lambs in their first year, with their grain offering, and 12 male goats for a purification offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the animals for the sacrifice for the peace offering were 24 young bulls, 60 rams, 60 male goats, and 60 lambs in their first year. These were the dedication offerings for the altar after it was anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the atonement lid that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim. Thus he spoke to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to Aaron and tell him, ‘When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps are to give light in front of the lampstand.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron did so; he set up the lamps to face toward the front of the lampstand, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is how the lampstand was made: It was beaten work in gold; from its shaft to its flowers it was beaten work. According to the pattern that the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites from among the Israelites and purify them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do this to them to purify them: Sprinkle water of purification on them; then have them shave all their body and wash their clothes, and so purify themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they are to take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil; and you are to take a second young bull for a purification offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to bring the Levites before the tent of meeting and assemble the entire community of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you are to bring the Levites before the Lord, and the Israelites are to lay their hands on the Levites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Aaron is to offer the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the Israelites, that they may do the work of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Levites lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, offer the one for a purification offering and the other for a whole burnt offering to the Lord, to make atonement for the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to have the Levites stand before Aaron and his sons, and then offer them as a wave offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so you are to separate the Levites from among the Israelites, and the Levites will be mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: “After this, the Levites will go in to do the work of the tent of meeting. So you must cleanse them and offer them like a wave offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are entirely given to me from among the Israelites. I have taken them for myself instead of all who open the womb, the firstborn sons of all the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the firstborn males among the Israelites are mine, both humans and animals; when I destroyed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I set them apart for myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn sons among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the Israelites, to do the work for the Israelites in the tent of meeting, and to make atonement for the Israelites, so there will be no plague among the Israelites when the Israelites come near the sanctuary.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron and the entire community of the Israelites did this with the Levites. According to all that the Lord commanded Moses concerning the Levites, this is what the Israelites did with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothing; then Aaron presented them like a wave offering before the Lord, and Aaron made atonement for them to purify them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, the Levites went in to do their work in the tent of meeting before Aaron and before his sons. As the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what pertains to the Levites: At the age of twenty-five years and upward one may begin to join the company in the work of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and at the age of fifty years they must retire from performing the work and may no longer work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They may assist their colleagues in the tent of meeting to attend to needs, but they must do no work. This is the way you must establish the Levites regarding their duties.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Israelites are to observe the Passover at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you are to observe it at its appointed time; you must keep it in accordance with all its statutes and all its customs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses instructed the Israelites to observe the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at twilight in the desert of Sinai; in accordance with all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened that some men who were ceremonially defiled by the dead body of a man could not keep the Passover on that day, so they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those men said to Moses, “We are ceremonially defiled by the dead body of a man; why are we kept back from offering the Lord’s offering at its appointed time among the Israelites?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to them, “Remain here and I will hear what the Lord will command concerning you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the Israelites, ‘If any of you or of your posterity become ceremonially defiled by touching a dead body, or are on a journey far away, then he may observe the Passover to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They may observe it on the fourteenth day of the second month at twilight; they are to eat it with bread made without yeast and with bitter herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must not leave any of it until morning, nor break any of its bones; they must observe it in accordance with every statute of the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But the man who is ceremonially clean, and was not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, that person must be cut off from his people. Because he did not bring the Lord’s offering at its appointed time, that man must bear his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a resident foreigner lives among you and wants to keep the Passover to the Lord, he must do so according to the statute of the Passover, and according to its custom. You must have the same statute for the resident foreigner and for the one who was born in the land.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day that the tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the tabernacle—the tent of the testimony—and from evening until morning there was a fiery appearance over the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the way it used to be continually: The cloud would cover it by day, and there was a fiery appearance by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, then after that the Israelites would begin their journey; and in whatever place the cloud settled, there the Israelites would make camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the commandment of the Lord the Israelites would begin their journey, and at the commandment of the Lord they would make camp; as long as the cloud remained settled over the tabernacle they would camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud remained over the tabernacle many days, then the Israelites obeyed the instructions of the Lord and did not journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud remained over the tabernacle a number of days, they remained camped according to the Lord’s commandment, and according to the Lord’s commandment they would journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the cloud remained only from evening until morning, when the cloud was taken up the following morning, then they traveled on. Whether by day or by night, when the cloud was taken up they traveled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it was for two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud prolonged its stay over the tabernacle, the Israelites remained camped without traveling; but when it was taken up, they traveled on.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the commandment of the Lord they camped, and at the commandment of the Lord they traveled on; they kept the instructions of the Lord according to the commandment of the Lord, by the authority of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Make two trumpets of silver; you are to make them from a single hammered piece. You will use them for assembling the community and for directing the traveling of the camps.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they blow them both, all the community must come to you to the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if they blow with one trumpet, then the leaders, the heads of the thousands of Israel, must come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow an alarm, then the camps that are located on the east side must begin to travel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you blow an alarm the second time, then the camps that are located on the south side must begin to travel. An alarm must be sounded for their journeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when you assemble the community, you must blow the trumpets, but you must not sound an alarm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Aaron, the priests, must blow the trumpets, and they will be to you for an eternal ordinance throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you go to war in your land against an adversary who opposes you, then you must sound an alarm with the trumpets, and you will be remembered before the Lord your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Also, in the time when you rejoice, such as on your appointed festivals or at the beginnings of your months, you must blow with your trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings, so that they may become a memorial for you before your God: I am the Lord your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites set out on their journeys from the desert of Sinai; and the cloud settled in the wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the first time they set out on their journey according to the commandment of the Lord, by the authority of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of the Judahites set out first according to their companies, and over his company was Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the company of the tribe of Issacharites was Nathanel son of Zuar,
speaker: Narrator

text: and over the company of the tribe of the Zebulunites was Eliab son of Helon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tabernacle was dismantled, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set out, carrying the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of Reuben set out according to their companies; over his company was Elizur son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the company of the tribe of the Simeonites was Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai,
speaker: Narrator

text: and over the company of the tribe of the Gadites was Eliasaph son of Deuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Kohathites set out, carrying the articles for the sanctuary; the tabernacle was to be set up before they arrived.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the standard of the camp of the Ephraimites set out according to their companies; over his company was Elishama son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the company of the tribe of the Manassehites was Gamaliel son of Pedahzur,
speaker: Narrator

text: and over the company of the tribe of Benjaminites was Abidan son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of the Danites set out, which was the rear guard of all the camps by their companies; over his company was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the company of the tribe of the Asherites was Pagiel son of Ocran,
speaker: Narrator

text: and over the company of the tribe of the Naphtalites was Ahira son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the traveling arrangements of the Israelites according to their companies when they traveled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel, the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are journeying to the place about which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will treat you well, for the Lord has promised good things for Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Hobab said to him, “I will not go, but I will go instead to my own land and to my kindred.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “Do not leave us, because you know places for us to camp in the wilderness, and you could be our guide.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you come with us, it is certain that whatever good things the Lord will favor us with, we will share with you as well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they traveled from the mountain of the Lord three days’ journey; and the ark of the covenant of the Lord was traveling before them during the three days’ journey, to find a resting place for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day, when they traveled from the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the ark traveled, Moses would say, “Rise up, O Lord! May your enemies be scattered, and may those who hate you flee before you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it came to rest he would say, “Return, O Lord, to the many thousands of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people complained, it displeased the Lord. When the Lord heard it, his anger burned, and so the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some of the outer parts of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people cried to Moses, he prayed to the Lord, and the fire died out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he called the name of that place Taberah because there the fire of the Lord burned among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the mixed multitude who were among them craved more desirable foods, and so the Israelites wept again and said, “If only we had meat to eat!
speaker: Narrator

text: We remember the fish we used to eat freely in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now we are dried up, and there is nothing at all before us except this manna!”
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its color like the color of bdellium.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people went about and gathered it, and ground it with mills or pounded it in mortars; they baked it in pans and made cakes of it. It tasted like fresh olive oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the dew came down on the camp in the night, the manna fell with it.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, everyone at the door of his tent; and when the anger of the Lord was kindled greatly, Moses was also displeased.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to the Lord, “Why have you afflicted your servant? Why have I not found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of this entire people on me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I conceive this entire people? Did I give birth to them, that you should say to me, ‘Carry them in your arms, as a foster father bears a nursing child,’ to the land that you swore to their fathers?
speaker: Narrator

text: From where shall I get meat to give to this entire people, for they cry to me, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat!’
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not able to bear this entire people alone, because it is too heavy for me!
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you are going to deal with me like this, then kill me immediately. If I have found favor in your sight then do not let me see my trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Gather to me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know are elders of the people and officials over them, and bring them to the tent of meeting; let them take their position there with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take part of the Spirit that is on you, and will put it on them, and they will bear some of the burden of the people with you, so that you do not bear it all by yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And say to the people, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, and you will eat meat, for you have wept in the hearing of the Lord, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat, for life was good for us in Egypt?” Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you will eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will eat, not just one day, nor two days, nor five days, nor ten days, nor twenty days,
speaker: Narrator

text: but a whole month, until it comes out your nostrils and makes you sick, because you have despised the Lord who is among you and have wept before him, saying, “Why did we ever come out of Egypt?”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “The people around me are 600,000 on foot; but you say, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat for a whole month.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Would they have enough if the flocks and herds were slaughtered for them? If all the fish of the sea were caught for them, would they have enough?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Is the Lord’s hand shortened? Now you will see whether my word to you will come true or not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord. He then gathered seventy men of the elders of the people and had them stand around the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to them, and he took some of the Spirit that was on Moses and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but did not do so again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But two men remained in the camp; one’s name was Eldad, and the other’s name was Medad. And the Spirit rested on them. (Now they were among those in the registration, but had not gone to the tabernacle.) So they prophesied in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a young man ran and told Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his choice young men, said, “My lord Moses, stop them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for me? I wish that all the Lord’s people were prophets, that the Lord would put his Spirit on them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned to the camp along with the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a wind went out from the Lord and brought quail from the sea, and let them fall near the camp, about a day’s journey on this side, and about a day’s journey on the other side, all around the camp, and about three feet high on the surface of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people stayed up all that day, all that night, and all the next day, and gathered the quail. The one who gathered the least gathered ten homers, and they spread them out for themselves all around the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before they chewed it, the anger of the Lord burned against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very great plague.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the name of that place was called Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people that craved different food.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people traveled from Kibroth Hattaavah to Hazeroth, and they stayed at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married (for he had married an Ethiopian woman).
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses? Has he not also spoken through us?” And the Lord heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more so than any man on the face of the earth.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke immediately to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam: “The three of you come to the tent of meeting.” So the three of them went.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent; he then called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, “Hear now my words: If there is a prophet among you, I the Lord will make myself known to him in a vision; I will speak with him in a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: My servant Moses is not like this; he is faithful in all my house.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him I will speak face to face, openly and not in riddles, and he will see the form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of the Lord burned against them, and he departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the cloud had departed from above the tent, there was Miriam, leprous like snow. Then Aaron turned toward Miriam, and realized that she was leprous.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Aaron said to Moses, “O my lord, please do not hold this sin against us, in which we have acted foolishly and have sinned!
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let her be like a baby born dead, whose flesh is half consumed when it comes out of its mother’s womb!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses cried to the Lord, “Heal her now, O God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “If her father had only spit in her face, would she not have been disgraced for seven days? Shut her out from the camp seven days, and afterward she can be brought back in again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Miriam was shut outside of the camp for seven days, and the people did not journey on until Miriam was brought back in.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that the people moved from Hazeroth and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Send out men to investigate the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites. You are to send one man from each ancestral tribe, each one a leader among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran at the command of the Lord. All of them were leaders of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Joseph, namely, the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vopshi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Maki.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to investigate the land. And Moses gave Hoshea son of Nun the name Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses sent them to investigate the land of Canaan, he told them, “Go up through the Negev, and then go up into the hill country
speaker: Narrator

text: and see what the land is like, and whether the people who live in it are strong or weak, few or many,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whether the land they live in is good or bad, and whether the cities they inhabit are like camps or fortified cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whether the land is rich or poor, and whether or not there are forests in it. And be brave, and bring back some of the fruit of the land.” Now it was the time of year for the first ripe grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went up and investigated the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, at Lebo Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went up through the Negev, they came to Hebron where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, descendants of Anak, were living. (Now Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the valley of Eshcol, they cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they carried it on a staff between two men, as well as some of the pomegranates and the figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: That place was called the Eshcol Valley, because of the cluster of grapes that the Israelites cut from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They returned from investigating the land after forty days.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came back to Moses and Aaron and to the whole community of the Israelites in the wilderness of Paran at Kadesh. They reported to the whole community and showed the fruit of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told Moses, “We went to the land where you sent us. It is indeed flowing with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the inhabitants are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. Moreover we saw the descendants of Anak there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amalekites live in the land of the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites live in the hill country; and the Canaanites live by the sea and along the banks of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Caleb silenced the people before Moses, saying, “Let us go up and occupy it, for we are well able to conquer it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We are not able to go up against these people, because they are stronger than we are!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they presented the Israelites with a discouraging report of the land they had investigated, saying, “The land that we passed through to investigate is a land that devours its inhabitants. All the people we saw there are of great stature.
speaker: Narrator

text: We even saw the Nephilim there (the descendants of Anak came from the Nephilim), and we seemed like grasshoppers both to ourselves and to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the community raised a loud cry, and the people wept that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Israelites murmured against Moses and Aaron, and the whole congregation said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt, or if only we had perished in this wilderness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why has the Lord brought us into this land only to be killed by the sword, that our wives and our children should become plunder? Wouldn’t it be better for us to return to Egypt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to one another, “Let’s appoint a leader and return to Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron fell down with their faces to the ground before the whole assembled community of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, two of those who had investigated the land, tore their garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to the whole community of the Israelites, “The land we passed through to investigate is an exceedingly good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord delights in us, then he will bring us into this land and give it to us—a land that is flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only do not rebel against the Lord, and do not fear the people of the land, for they are bread for us. Their protection has turned aside from them, but the Lord is with us. Do not fear them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the whole community threatened to stone them. But the glory of the Lord appeared to all the Israelites at the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “How long will this people despise me, and how long will they not believe in me, in spite of the signs that I have done among them?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will strike them with the pestilence, and I will disinherit them—I will make you into a nation that is greater and mightier than they!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “When the Egyptians hear it—for you brought up this people by your power from among them—
speaker: Narrator

text: then they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that you, Lord, are among this people, that you, Lord, are seen face to face, that your cloud stands over them, and that you go before them by day in a pillar of cloud and in a pillar of fire by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you kill this entire people at once, then the nations that have heard of your fame will say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the land that he swore to them, he killed them in the wilderness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, let the power of my Lord be great, just as you have said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abounding in loyal love, forgiving iniquity and transgression, but by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children until the third and fourth generations.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Please forgive the iniquity of this people according to your great loyal love, just as you have forgiven this people from Egypt even until now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said, “I have forgiven them as you asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: But truly, as I live, all the earth will be filled with the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the people have seen my glory and my signs that I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and yet have tempted me now these ten times, and have not obeyed me—
speaker: Narrator

text: they will by no means see the land that I promised on oath to their fathers, nor will any of them who despised me see it—
speaker: Narrator

text: Only my servant Caleb, because he had a different spirit and has followed me fully—I will bring him into the land where he had gone, and his descendants will possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites were living in the valleys.) Tomorrow, turn and journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:
speaker: Narrator

text: “How long must I bear with this evil congregation that murmurs against me? I have heard the complaints of the Israelites that they murmured against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to them, ‘As I live, says the Lord, I will surely do to you just what you have spoken in my hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness—all those of you who were numbered, according to your full number, from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will by no means enter into the land where I swore to settle you. The only exceptions are Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will bring in your little ones, whom you said would become victims of war, and they will enjoy the land that you have despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: and your children will wander in the wilderness forty years and suffer for your unfaithfulness, until your dead bodies lie finished in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number of the days you have investigated this land, forty days—one day for a year—you will suffer for your iniquities, forty years, and you will know what it means to thwart me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, have said, “I will surely do so to all this evil congregation that has gathered together against me. In this wilderness they will be finished, and there they will die!”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men whom Moses sent to investigate the land, who returned and made the whole community murmur against him by producing an evil report about the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: those men who produced the evil report about the land, died by the plague before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among the men who went to investigate the land, lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses told these things to all the Israelites, the people mourned greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning they went up to the crest of the hill country, saying, “Here we are, and we will go up to the place that the Lord commanded, for we have sinned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said, “Why are you now transgressing the commandment of the Lord? It will not succeed!
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go up, for the Lord is not among you, and you will be defeated before your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you will fall by the sword. Because you have turned away from the Lord, the Lord will not be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they dared to go up to the crest of the hill, although neither the ark of the covenant of the Lord nor Moses departed from the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country swooped down and attacked them as far as Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you enter the land where you are to live, which I am giving you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you make an offering by fire to the Lord from the herd or from the flock (whether a burnt offering or a sacrifice for discharging a vow or as a freewill offering or in your solemn feasts) to create a pleasing aroma to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the one who presents his offering to the Lord must bring a grain offering of one-tenth of an ephah of finely ground flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of olive oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must also prepare one-fourth of a hin of wine for a drink offering with the burnt offering or the sacrifice for each lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or for a ram, you must prepare as a grain offering two-tenths of an ephah of finely ground flour mixed with one-third of a hin of olive oil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for a drink offering you must offer one-third of a hin of wine as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice for discharging a vow or as a peace offering to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: then a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of finely ground flour mixed with half a hin of olive oil must be presented with the young bull,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you must present as the drink offering half a hin of wine with the fire offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what is to be done for each ox, or each ram, or each of the male lambs or the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must do so for each one according to the number that you prepare.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Every native-born person must do these things in this way to present an offering made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a resident foreigner is living with you—or whoever is among you in future generations—and prepares an offering made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the Lord, he must do it the same way you are to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: One statute must apply to you who belong to the congregation and to the resident foreigner who is living among you, as a permanent statute for your future generations. You and the resident foreigner will be alike before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: One law and one custom must apply to you and to the resident foreigner who lives alongside you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you enter the land to which I am bringing you
speaker: Narrator

text: and you eat some of the food of the land, you must offer up a raised offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must offer up a cake of the first of your finely ground flour as a raised offering; as you offer the raised offering of the threshing floor, so you must offer it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must give to the Lord some of the first of your finely ground flour as a raised offering in your future generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If you sin unintentionally and do not observe all these commandments that the Lord has spoken to Moses—
speaker: Narrator

text: all that the Lord has commanded you by the authority of Moses, from the day that the Lord commanded Moses and continuing through your future generations—
speaker: Narrator

text: then if anything is done unintentionally without the knowledge of the community, the whole community must prepare one young bull for a burnt offering—for a pleasing aroma to the Lord—along with its grain offering and its customary drink offering, and one male goat for a purification offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest is to make atonement for the whole community of the Israelites, and they will be forgiven, because it was unintentional and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to the Lord, and their purification offering before the Lord, for their unintentional offense.
speaker: Narrator
