speaker: Narrator

text: But all the young women who have not experienced a man’s bed will be yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Any of you who has killed anyone or touched any of the dead, remain outside the camp for seven days; purify yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must purify each garment and everything that is made of skin, everything made of goats’ hair, and everything made of wood.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had gone into the battle, “This is the ordinance of the law that the Lord commanded Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Only the gold, the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
speaker: Narrator

text: everything that may stand the fire, you are to pass through the fire, and it will be ceremonially clean, but it must still be purified with the water of purification. Anything that cannot withstand the fire you must pass through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you will be ceremonially clean, and afterward you may enter the camp.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “You and Eleazar the priest, and all the family leaders of the community, take the sum of the plunder that was captured, both people and animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Divide the plunder into two parts, one for those who took part in the war—who went out to battle—and the other for all the community.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You must exact a tribute for the Lord from the fighting men who went out to battle: one life out of 500, from the people, the cattle, and from the donkeys and the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to take it from their half share and give it to Eleazar the priest for a raised offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ half share you are to take one portion out of fifty of the people, the cattle, the donkeys, and the sheep—from every kind of animal—and you are to give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spoil that remained of the plunder that the fighting men had gathered was 675,000 sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: 72,000 cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: 61,000 donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and 32,000 young women who had not experienced a man’s bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half portion of those who went to war numbered 337,500 sheep;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Lord’s tribute from the sheep was 675.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cattle numbered 36,000; the Lord’s tribute was 72.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkeys were 30,500, of which the Lord’s tribute was 61.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were 16,000, of which the Lord’s tribute was 32 people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave the tribute, which was the Lord’s raised offering, to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ half share that Moses had separated from the fighting men,
speaker: Narrator

text: there were 337,500 sheep from the portion belonging to the community,
speaker: Narrator

text: 36,000 cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: 30,500 donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and 16,000 people.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ share Moses took one of every fifty people and animals and gave them to the Levites who were responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the commanders over thousands and the commanders over hundreds, approached Moses
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Your servants have taken a count of the men who were in the battle, who were under our authority, and not one is missing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we have brought as an offering for the Lord what each man found: gold ornaments, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, all of it in the form of ornaments.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold of the offering they offered up to the Lord from the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds weighed 16,750 shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each soldier had taken plunder for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Reubenites and the Gadites possessed a very large number of cattle. When they saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were ideal for cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Gadites and the Reubenites came and addressed Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community. They said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
speaker: Narrator

text: the land that the Lord subdued before the community of Israel, is ideal for cattle, and your servants have cattle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for our inheritance. Do not have us cross the Jordan River.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Gadites and the Reubenites, “Must your brothers go to war while you remain here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you frustrate the intent of the Israelites to cross over into the land that the Lord has given them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers did the same thing when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went up to the Eshcol Valley and saw the land, they frustrated the intent of the Israelites so that they did not enter the land that the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the anger of the Lord was kindled that day, and he swore,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Because they have not followed me wholeheartedly, not one of the men twenty years old and upward who came from Egypt will see the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua son of Nun, for they followed the Lord wholeheartedly.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord’s anger was kindled against the Israelites, and he made them wander in the wilderness for forty years, until all that generation that had done wickedly before the Lord was finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now look, you are standing in your fathers’ place, a brood of sinners, to increase still further the fierce wrath of the Lord against the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you turn away from following him, he will once again abandon them in the wilderness, and you will be the reason for their destruction.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came very close to him and said, “We will build sheep folds here for our flocks and cities for our families,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we will maintain ourselves in armed readiness and go before the Israelites until whenever we have brought them to their place. Our descendants will be living in fortified towns as a protection against the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not return to our homes until every Israelite has his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will not accept any inheritance on the other side of the Jordan River and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this eastern side of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses replied, “If you will do this thing, and if you will arm yourselves for battle before the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if all your armed men cross the Jordan before the Lord until he drives out his enemies from his presence
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land is subdued before the Lord, then afterward you may return and be free of your obligation to the Lord and to Israel. This land will then be your possession in the Lord’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if you do not do this, then look, you will have sinned against the Lord. And know that your sin will find you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So build cities for your descendants and pens for your sheep, but do what you have said you would do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Gadites and the Reubenites replied to Moses, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our children, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock will be there in the cities of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: but your servants will cross over, every man armed for war, to do battle in the Lord’s presence, just as my lord says.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the heads of the families of the Israelite tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them: “If the Gadites and the Reubenites cross the Jordan with you, each one equipped for battle in the Lord’s presence, and you conquer the land, then you must allot them the territory of Gilead as their possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they do not cross over with you armed, they must receive possessions among you in Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Gadites and the Reubenites answered, “Your servants will do what the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will cross armed in the Lord’s presence into the land of Canaan, and then the possession of our inheritance that we inherit will be ours on this side of the Jordan River.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave to the Gadites, the Reubenites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the realm of King Sihon of the Amorites, and the realm of King Og of Bashan, the entire land with its cities and the territory surrounding them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gadites rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Atroth Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran as fortified cities, and constructed pens for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebo, Baal Meon (with a change of name), and Sibmah. They renamed the cities they built.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave Gilead to Machir, son of Manasseh, and he lived there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jair son of Manasseh went and captured their small towns and named them Havvoth Jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah after his own name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the journeys of the Israelites, who went out of the land of Egypt by their divisions under the authority of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses recorded their departures according to their journeys, by the commandment of the Lord; now these are their journeys according to their departures.
speaker: Narrator

text: They departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the day after the Passover the Israelites went out defiantly in plain sight of all the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had killed among them; the Lord also executed judgments on their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites traveled from Rameses and camped in Sukkoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Sukkoth, and camped in Etham, which is on the edge of the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Etham, and turned again to Pi Hahiroth, which is before Baal Zephon; and they camped before Migdal.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Pi Hahiroth, and passed through the middle of the sea into the wilderness, and went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and camped in Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Marah and came to Elim; in Elim there are twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees, so they camped there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Elim, and camped by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the Red Sea and camped in the wilderness of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the wilderness of Sin and camped in Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they traveled from Dophkah, and camped in Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rephidim and camped in the desert of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the desert of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Hazeroth and camped in Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rimmon Perez and camped in Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rissah and camped in Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Mount Shepher and camped in Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Haradah and camped in Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Tahath and camped at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Terah and camped in Mithcah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Mithcah and camped in Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Hashmonah and camped in Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Moseroth and camped in Bene Jaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Hor Haggidgad and camped in Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Jotbathah and camped in Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Ezion Geber and camped in the wilderness of Zin, that is, Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor at the edge of the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron the priest ascended Mount Hor at the command of the Lord, and he died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt on the first day of the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Arad, the Canaanite king who lived in the south of the land of Canaan, heard about the approach of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Mount Hor and camped in Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Zalmonah and camped in Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Punon and camped in Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Oboth and camped in Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Iim and camped in Dibon Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Dibon Gad and camped in Almon Diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim before Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the rift valley plains by Moab along the Jordan River across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: They camped by the Jordan, from Beth Jeshimoth as far as Abel Shittim in the rift valley plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the rift valley plains of Moab along the Jordan, across from Jericho. He said:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you have crossed the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: you must drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you. Destroy all their carved images, all their molten images, and demolish their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must dispossess the inhabitants of the land and live in it, for I have given you the land to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must divide the land by lot for an inheritance among your families. To a larger group you must give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group you must give a smaller inheritance. Everyone’s inheritance must be in the place where his lot falls. You must inherit according to your ancestral tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land before you, then those whom you allow to remain will be irritants in your eyes and thorns in your side, and will cause you trouble in the land where you will be living.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what I intended to do to them I will do to you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Give these instructions to the Israelites, and tell them: ‘When you enter Canaan, the land that has been assigned to you as an inheritance, the land of Canaan with its borders,
speaker: Narrator

text: your southern border will extend from the wilderness of Zin along the Edomite border, and your southern border will run eastward to the extremity of the Salt Sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and then the border will turn from the south to the Scorpion Ascent, continue to Zin, and then its direction will be from the south to Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and pass over to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: There the border will turn from Azmon to the Stream of Egypt, and then its direction is to the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And for a western border you will have the Great Sea. This will be your western border.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And this will be your northern border: From the Great Sea you will draw a line to Mount Hor;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Mount Hor you will draw a line to Lebo Hamath, and the direction of the border will be to Zedad.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border will continue to Ziphron, and its direction will be to Hazar Enan. This will be your northern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘For your eastern border you will draw a line from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border will run down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain, and the border will descend and reach the eastern side of the Sea of Kinnereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border will continue down the Jordan River and its direction will be to the Salt Sea. This will be your land by its borders that surround it.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded the Israelites: “This is the land that you will inherit by lot, which the Lord has commanded to be given to the nine-and-a-half tribes,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the tribe of the Reubenites by their families, the tribe of the Gadites by their families, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two-and-a-half tribes have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan, east of Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the names of the men who are to allocate the land to you as an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must take one leader from every tribe to assist in allocating the land as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of the Simeonites, Shemuel son of Ammihud;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Kislon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of the Danites, a leader, Bukki son of Jogli.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Josephites, Hanniel son of Ephod, a leader from the tribe of Manasseh;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of the Ephraimites, a leader, Kemuel son of Shiphtan;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of the Zebulunites, a leader, Elizaphan son of Parnach;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of the Issacharites, a leader, Paltiel son of Azzan;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of the Asherites, a leader, Ahihud son of Shelomi;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of the Naphtalites, a leader, Pedahel son of Ammihud.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones whom the Lord commanded to divide up the inheritance among the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the rift valley plains of Moab along the Jordan near Jericho. He said:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Instruct the Israelites to give the Levites towns to live in from the inheritance the Israelites will possess. You must also give the Levites grazing land around the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they will have towns in which to live, and their grazing lands will be for their cattle, for their possessions, and for all their animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grazing lands around the towns that you will give to the Levites must extend to a distance of 500 yards from the town wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You must measure from outside the wall of the town on the east 1,000 yards, and on the south side 1,000 yards, and on the west side 1,000 yards, and on the north side 1,000 yards, with the town in the middle. This territory must belong to them as grazing land for the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now from these towns that you will give to the Levites you must select six towns of refuge to which a person who has killed someone may flee. And you must give them forty-two other towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So the total of the towns you will give the Levites is forty-eight. You must give these together with their grazing lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns you will give must be from the possession of the Israelites. From the larger tribes you must give more; and from the smaller tribes fewer. Each must contribute some of its own towns to the Levites in proportion to the inheritance allocated to each.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you cross over the Jordan River into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: you must then designate some towns as towns of refuge for you, to which a person who has killed someone unintentionally may flee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they must stand as your towns of refuge from the avenger in order that the killer may not die until he has stood trial before the community.
speaker: Narrator

text: These towns that you must give shall be your six towns for refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘You must give three towns on this side of the Jordan, and you must give three towns in the land of Canaan; they must be towns of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six towns will be places of refuge for the Israelites, and for the resident foreigner, and for the settler among them, so that anyone who kills any person accidentally may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if he hits someone with an iron tool so that he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer must surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he strikes him by throwing a stone large enough that he could die, and he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer must surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if he strikes him with a wooden hand weapon so that he could die, and he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer must surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The avenger of blood himself must kill the murderer; when he meets him, he must kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if he strikes him out of hatred or throws something at him intentionally so that he dies,
speaker: Narrator

text: or with enmity he strikes him with his hand and he dies, the one who struck him must surely be put to death, for he is a murderer. The avenger of blood must kill the murderer when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if he strikes him suddenly, without enmity, or throws anything at him unintentionally,
speaker: Narrator

text: or with any stone large enough that a man could die, without seeing him, and throws it at him, and he dies, even though he was not his enemy nor sought his harm,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the community must judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these decisions.
speaker: Narrator

text: The community must deliver the slayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the community must restore him to the town of refuge to which he fled, and he must live there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the consecrated oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the slayer at any time goes outside the boundary of the town to which he had fled,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the borders of the town of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the slayer, he will not be guilty of blood,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the slayer should have stayed in his town of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest, the slayer may return to the land of his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: So these things must be a statutory ordinance for you throughout your generations, in all the places where you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever kills any person, the murderer must be put to death by the testimony of witnesses, but one witness cannot testify against any person to cause him to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, you must not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death; he must surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you must not accept a ransom for anyone who has fled to a town of refuge, to allow him to return home and live on his own land before the death of the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘You must not pollute the land where you live, for blood defiles the land, and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed there, except by the blood of the person who shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore do not defile the land that you will inhabit, in which I live, for I the Lord live among the Israelites.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the heads of the family groups of the Gileadites, the descendant of Machir, the descendant of Manasseh, who were from the Josephite families, approached and spoke before Moses and the leaders who were the heads of the Israelite families.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance by lot to the Israelites; and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if they should be married to one of the men from another Israelite tribe, their inheritance would be taken from the inheritance of our fathers and added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry. As a result, it will be taken from the lot of our inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Jubilee of the Israelites is to take place, their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry. So their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our ancestral tribe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses gave a ruling to the Israelites by the word of the Lord: “What the tribe of the Josephites is saying is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord has commanded for Zelophehad’s daughters: ‘Let them marry whomever they think best, only they must marry within the family of their father’s tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way the inheritance of the Israelites will not be transferred from tribe to tribe. But every one of the Israelites must retain the ancestral heritage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every daughter who possesses an inheritance from any of the tribes of the Israelites must become the wife of a man from any family in her father’s tribe, so that every Israelite may retain the inheritance of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: No inheritance may pass from tribe to tribe. But every one of the tribes of the Israelites must retain its inheritance.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so the daughters of Zelophehad did.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the daughters of Zelophehad—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—were married to the sons of their uncles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were married into the families of the Manassehites, the descendants of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of their father’s family.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commandments and the decisions that the Lord commanded the Israelites through the authority of Moses, in the rift valley plains by Moab along the Jordan River opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
